DOC.brief_summary: Neuromas are frequent after trauma and surgery, including amputation and can be identified by high-resolution ultrasound. The role of neuromas as the cause of neuropathic pain is uncertain. The investigators therefore wish to explore if spontaneous and evoked pain will be relieved by injection of local anesthetics near painful neuromas in subjects with peripheral nerve injury.
DOC.brief_title: Neuromas as the Cause of Pain
DOC.criteria: Subjects with peripheral nerve injury 3 months prior to participation Severe somatic or psychiatric diseases Other peripheral neuropathy Lack of ability to cooperate to the clinical examination Allergy to Lidocaine or similar analgetics
